The electrochemical cell shown below is a concentration cell. M | M2+ (saturated solution of a sparingly soluble salt, MX2) || M2+ (0.001 mol dm–3) | M The emf of the cell depends on the difference in concentrations of M2+ ions at the two electrodes. The emf of the cell at 298 K is 0.059 V. 


The value of ∆G (kJ mol–1) for the given cell is (take 1F = 96500 C mol–1)

questions.question:
The electrochemical cell shown below is a concentration cell. M | M^{2+} (saturated solution of a sparingly soluble salt, MX_{2}) || M^{2+} (0.001 mol dm^{–3}) | M The emf of the cell depends on the difference in concentrations of M^{2+} ions at the two electrodes. The emf of the cell at 298 K is 0.059 V. 
The value of ∆G (kJ mol^{–1}) for the given cell is (take 1F = 96500 C mol^{–1})

questions.question_text:
The electrochemical cell shown below is a concentration cell. M | M2+ (saturated solution of a sparingly soluble salt, MX2) || M2+ (0.001 mol dm–3) | M The emf of the cell depends on the difference in concentrations of M2+ ions at the two electrodes. The emf of the cell at 298 K is 0.059 V. 


The solubility product (Ksp; mol3 dm–9) of MX2 at 298 K based on the information available for the given concentration cell is (take 2.303 $$\times$$ R $$\times$$ 298/F = 0.059 V)

$$g\left( x \right) = \int\limits_1^x {\left( {{{2\left( {t - 1} \right)} \over {t + 1}} - In\,t} \right)f\left( t \right)dt} $$ for all $$x \in \left( {1,\,\infty } \right)$$.

$$P:$$ There exists some $$x \in R$$ such that $$f\left( x \right) + 2x = 2\left( {1 + {x^2}} \right)$$

Then

Two solid cylinders P and Q of same mass and same radius start rolling down a fixed inclined
plane from the same height at the same time. Cylinder P has most of its mass concentrated near
its surface, while Q has most of its mass concentrated near the axis. Which statement(s) is(are)
correct?

options.A: Both cylinders P and Q reach the ground at the same time.
options.B: Cylinders P has larger linear acceleration than cylinder Q.
options.C: Both cylinders reach the ground with same translational kinetic energy.
options.D: Cylinder Q reaches the ground with larger angular speed.

Two solid cylinders P and Q of same mass and same radius start rolling down a fixed inclined
plane from the same height at the same time. Cylinder P has most of its mass concentrated near
its surface, while Q has most of its mass concentrated near the axis. Which statement(s) is(are)
correct?

questions.question_text:
Consider a disc rotating in the horizontal plane with a constant angular speed $$\omega $$ about its centre
O. The disc has a shaded region on one side of the diameter and an unshaded region on the
other side as shown in the figure. When the disc is in the orientation as shown, two pebbles P
and Q are simultaneously projected at an angle towards R. The velocity of projection is in the y - z
plane and is same for both pebbles with respect to the disc. Assume that (i) they land back on
the disc before the disc has completed $${1 \over 8}$$ rotation, (ii) their range is less than half the disc radius,
and (iii) $$\omega $$ remains constant throughout. Then
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: P lands in the shaded region and Q in the unshaded region.
options.B: P lands in the unshaded region and Q in the shaded region.
options.C: Both P and Q land in the unshaded region.
options.D: Both P and Q land in the shaded region.

questions.question:

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements about the instantaneous axis (passing through the centre of mass) is correct?
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: It is vertical for both Cases (a) and (b).
options.B: It is vertical for Case (a); and is at 45$$^\circ$$ to the xz-plane and lies in the plane of the disc for Case (b).
options.C: It is horizontal for Case (a); and is 45$$^\circ$$ to the xz-plane and is normal to the plane of the disc for Case (b).
options.D: It is vertical for Case (a); and is 45$$^\circ$$ to the xz-plane and is normal to the plane of the disc for Case (b).

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements regarding the angular speed about the instantaneous axis (passing through the centre of mass) is correct?
questions.subject: Physics

options.B: It is $$\omega$$ for case (a); and $$\omega$$ / $$\sqrt2$$ for case (b).
options.C: It is $$\omega$$ for case (a); and $$\sqrt2$$$$\omega$$ for case (b).

questions.question_text: Choose the correct statement.
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: The speed of light in the meta-material is v = c|n|.
options.B: The speed of light in the meta-material is $$v = {c \over {|n|}}$$.
options.C: The speed of light in the meta-material is v = c.
options.D: The wavelength of the light in the meta-material ($$\lambda$$_{m}) is given by $${\lambda _m} = {\lambda _{air}}|n|$$, where $${\lambda _{air}}$$ is wavelength of the light in air.

questions.subject: Physics

options.A: the emf induced in the loop is zero if the current is constant.
options.B: the emf induced in the loop is finite if the current is constant.
options.C: the emf induced in the loop is zero if the current decreases at a steady state
options.D: the emf induced in the loop is finite if the current decreases at a steady state.
